comments.body: As an alternative to save space, could we just pickle the `call` and re-inline it in the unpickler?
It might be possible in some situations, but it does not look straightforward. In other situations (e.g. inlined trees materialized by implicit macros) it's impossible.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +445,449 @@        writeByte(REPEATED)
        withLength { pickleTree(elemtpt); elems.foreach(pickleTree) }
      case Inlined(call, bindings, expansion) =>
        writeByte(INLINED)
        bindings.foreach(preRegister)
